TopicTitle: imkSushi's renaming the Sun to Kerbol Mod

Articles.Content:
This mod REQUIRES Kopernicus
This mod renames the Sun to Kerbol, as it should actually be named. It also changes descriptions to say Kerbol, and not the Sun.
Should be compatible with all planet packs.

Download from Spacedock: http://spacedock.info/mod/734/imkSushi%27s%20renaming%20the%20Sun%20to%20Kerbol%20Mod

Credits:
Me - for doing all the code
ThomasP - for Kopernicus
Squad - for ksp
Any one who downloads the mod, for dowloading the mod.

MIT Licence - Basically, don't do naughty stuff with my mod.

NOTE:
The mod files are under Gamedata/imkSushi/Sun to Kerbol if you are looking for them (I know, it's a lot of code)

Edited June 3, 2016 by ImkSushi
So simple, yet so necessary! I love it!

26 minutes ago, Noname115 said:

So simple, yet so necessary! I love it!

I know. What vexes me is that nobody else has done it before me. I guess there is a first for everything.

A few things:

  • License is listed as MIT on space dock but not listed in OP or included in download. It's a requirement or bad stuff happens.
  • You sure this is compatible with all planet packs? I don't know much about how Kopernicus works, but I seem to recall planets often specifically have their reference points set to "Sun" which you've now changed to "Kerbol." Looking at the files...I didn't see any accounting for this, as far as compatibility patches go. I could be wrong about this though.

Cheers,

Edited June 3, 2016 by Deimos Rast

54 minutes ago, Deimos Rast said:

A few things:

  • License is listed as MIT on space dock but not listed in OP or included in download. It's a requirement or bad stuff happens.
  • You sure this is compatible with all planet packs? I don't know much about how Kopernicus works, but I seem to recall planets often specifically have their reference points set to "Sun" which you've now changed to "Kerbol." Looking at the files...I didn't see any accounting for this, as far as compatibility patches go. I could be wrong about this though.

Cheers,

This doesn't seem to change anything properties of the Sun except it's displayed name which as far as I'm aware should have no effect on mods calling upon the Sun as a reference body

Just now, Nhawks17 said:

This doesn't seem to change anything properties of the Sun except it's displayed name which as far as I'm aware should have no effect on mods calling upon the Sun as a reference body

I stand corrected. Thanks.

4 hours ago, Deimos Rast said:

A few things:

  • License is listed as MIT on space dock but not listed in OP or included in download. It's a requirement or bad stuff happens.
  • You sure this is compatible with all planet packs? I don't know much about how Kopernicus works, but I seem to recall planets often specifically have their reference points set to "Sun" which you've now changed to "Kerbol." Looking at the files...I didn't see any accounting for this, as far as compatibility patches go. I could be wrong about this though.

Cheers,

I just edited it to say the license.

Also, as @Nhawks17 said, this only changes the display name, not the internal name. If it changed the internal name then paradoxes would happen, and then I'd also have to worry about the other planets as well. Kopernicus doesn't let me change internal names, I've tried.
